In this session, we share proven techniques for writing business-critical web applications, no matter the size of the app. Learn our lessons and successes while we migrate one of Google's largest web applications to the modern web and Dart, giving you concrete tips you can use in your next rewrite. sessions.description:
The Google Play apps suite started as five separate projects -- Play Store, Play Music, Play Books, Play Movies and Play Magazines -- each with its own visual style and presence on devices and the web. Through 2013 and 2014 we worked to bring these together under a single design and common brand, with a unified experience across multiple screens and devices.

In this session we’ll look at the Play design to see how it scales along two key vectors: consistency across tasks such as exploring, purchasing and consuming digital content; and consistency across a broad spectrum of screens, from phones to tablets to the web on 30" desktop monitors. We’ll highlight the cards and clusters that organize content and look at the building blocks that let us implement a responsive design. Join us to hear why we set out on this journey and what we’ve learned along the way.
sessions.title: Going responsive with the Google Play Apps Suite

sessions.description: Reintroducing the mobile web! What is the mobile web good at? Why should developers build for it?  And how do mobile web and native complement each other?  The mobile web is often the first experience new users have with your brand and you're on the hook for delivering success to them. There's been massive investment in mobile browsers; so now we have the speed, the features, and the tools to help you make great mobile web apps.

sessions.description: One of cloud's promises is to reduce your devops workload and allow your development to be more agile. In this session we will demo how to use the upcoming version of Google Cloud Release Pipelines to release your application through a multi-stage built/test/deployment pipeline. The Release Pipeline is based on tools you are already familiar with such as Jenkins, Maven and Git. Many of the repetitive tasks are automated so you can spend more time on your application. At the same time you will have visibility and control over how your application is released.
sessions.title: Continuous integration with Google Cloud Release Pipelines

sessions.description: With over one million Android apps and games on Google Play, it can be difficult to stand out. In this talk, we'll focus on the strategies that successful game developers are taking to build long-lasting user bases. We'll discuss the different distribution strategies and how to choose them, and provide tips and best practices that will help you successfully distribute your games.
sessions.title: Keys to successful distribution of Android games

sessions.description: Learn how to do more with the platform to come up with better and more engaging user interfaces.
sessions.title: Advanced Android UI

sessions.description: Are you a developer who wants to develop just one version of your application? Do you have an Android app using the NDK, but are struggling to find time to port all your C++ code to JavaScript for a web version? Come learn about how to use Portable Native Client to bring your native applications to the web. Hear case studies of Google Maps and IPython notebooks, and learn about the new tools we've brought to Native Client to make deployment a breeze.
sessions.title: Distributing Native Code on the web using PNaCl

sessions.description: Developers are finding great success on Google Play, where four times more money was paid out to developers in 2013 than in 2012. In this session, we’ll review developer success stories and the drivers of revenue, and we’ll share tips for developers to get the most out of Google Play.
sessions.title: Making money on Google Play

sessions.description: Can you predict the future using Big Data? Can you divine if your users will come back to your site or where the next social conflict will arise? And most importantly, can Brazil be defeated at soccer on their own turf? In this talk, we'll go through the process of data extraction, modelling and prediction as well as generating a live dashboard to visualize the results. We’ll demonstrate how you can use Google Cloud and Open Source technologies to make predictions about the biggest soccer matches in the world. You’ll see how to use Google BigQuery for data analytics and Monte Carlo simulations, as well as how to create machine learning models in R and pandas. We predict that after this talk you’ll have the necessary tools to cast your own eye on the future.
sessions.title: Predicting the future with the Google Cloud Platform

sessions.description:
This summer Project Tango launches. On a rocket. To space. Project Tango’s Android smart-phone-like device is scheduled to fly 230 miles above the earth. It will construct a 3D-map of the International Space Station and enable autonomous navigation of a floating robotic platform. The goal: Create a robotic assistant for astronauts. And our earthling activities? Augmented reality, architecture, retail, gaming. We’re harnessing 10 years of advances in computer vision and robotics to build perhaps one of the most powerful mobile devices ever made. One with human-scale understanding of space and motion. Epic.

120 countries, 6,827 developers on line, 48,486 module developer kits downloaded. For the first developer’s conference. Project Ara asks how we bring the benefits of an open hardware ecosystem to 6B people. It’s physical. We want to do for hardware what open platforms have done for software… create a vibrant third-party developer ecosystem, lower the barrier to entry, increase the pace of innovation, and compress development timelines.  

From imaging and authentication to a new creative canvas that powers mobile storytelling. Universities to large scale manufacturers. Your garage to zero g.  

Diversity. Scale. Speed. Google’s Advanced Technology and Projects group. ATAP. A small band of pirates who believe the future is what we choose to make. And that we choose to make what we believe in. We believe the future is awesome. We can build it faster together. ATAP + developers = some epic sh*t.
sessions.title: A 3D tablet, an OSCAR, and a little cash. Tango, Spotlight, Ara. ATAP.

sessions.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.
sessions.title: Build for the multi-device Web

sessions.description: Join us as we record, live and onstage, a custom "Theme for I/O" song using the mobile web. With WebRTC, Web Audio, Dart, and Chrome for Android, Soundtrap built a collaborative music authoring system. We'll show you how to add real-time communication and audio to your mobile web app.
sessions.title: Making music mobile with the Web

sessions.description: Meet build tools that developers can use to profile and debug their games on devices with ARM Mali GPUs. The scope of this presentation is to show how ARM DS-5 and the Mali Graphics Debugger can be used to analyze and debug any Android application, from UIs to games, including WebGL.
sessions.title: ARM tooling and performance

sessions.description: There’s arguably no area today where innovation is more critical than in the nonprofit sector — it’s an area trying to reach billions of people and crack some of the most complex issues faced by society. From expanding access to social services for low-income residents to improving access to education, social entrepreneurs are increasingly using technology to create new solutions to old problems. Google’s Impact Challenges travel the world asking social entrepreneurs to tell us their ideas for using technology to make their local community a better place. Winners receive funding and Google support to make their ideas a reality. This is a unique opportunity to hear from three Bay Area winners, One Degree, Beyond12 and Hack to Hood, understand their inspiration for changing the world, and learn about how you as a developer can do transformative things with technology in your local community.
sessions.title: Strengthening communities with technology: A discussion with Bay Area Impact Challenge finalists

sessions.description: Join us for an in-depth discussion of the Glassware review process and the steps you can take to get your Glassware in the hands of Explorers quickly and easily.
sessions.title: Distributing your Glassware

sessions.description: Web components are a game changer. Unlike other new features, the technologies are purely about developer productivity, solving many of web development's shortcomings. Polymer and web components change how we think about, design, and compose web applications. Learn how the Web Components revolution makes you more productive and reduces the cognitive load of being a web developer.
sessions.title: Polymer and Web Components change everything you know about Web development

sessions.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.
sessions.title: Android and cloud

sessions.description: SourceGraph is a code search and analytics engine that indexes the world of open source code. In this session we'll see how a small team used Go to build the service.
sessions.title: Sourcegraph: A code search engine in Go

sessions.description: Dart is a language, runtime, and toolset for building scalable web applications for the modern web. We are excited to bring the power and productivity of the Dart platform to the server. In this session you will see how to build a Dart application that spans the server and the browser, debug the application on mobile, and deploy to the recently announced Managed VMs on Google Cloud. You will learn how to structure an application for maximum code reuse, easy maintenance, and fast turn-around.
sessions.title: Connecting Cloud and Web: Deploying end-to-end apps

sessions.description: Get the most out of Google's Cloud Platform with Go, a productive, high-performance language for the cloud. This talk will cover the nuts and bolts of putting together an App Engine app in Go.
sessions.title: Building a web app on App Engine

sessions.description: The web platform has never been better for building and deploying rich interactive applications.  HTML5 allows us to focus on a great user experience across clients.  In this presentation, we'll share the principles, tools and practices that enable us to combat platform fragmentation, move quickly and deploy frequently.
sessions.title: HTML5 everywhere: How and why YouTube uses the Web platform

sessions.description: Learn how to utilize the Google Cloud platform and open source tools to predict the future.  We will explore various data processing, modeling and interactive analysis processes used to predict the outcome of professional soccer matches.
sessions.title: Predicting the future in the Cloud

sessions.description: The Glass platform has expanded dramatically with the introduction of the GDK and recent update to KitKat.  This session will provide a deep analysis of the Glass software platform and provide developers with tools, APIs, and sample code to build truly innovative user experiences on Glass.
sessions.title: Innovate with the Glass Platform

sessions.description: Not sure how to organizer your Go projects? Trapped in a maze of twisty dependencies, all alike? In this session we'll look at some practical examples of how to organize Go code into packages and how to manage third party dependencies for distribution and deployment.
sessions.title: Organizing code and managing dependencies

sessions.description: We review your Android, Web, Google Cast, Glass, and Wear apps and provide live feedback. Details on nominating your app for review are coming soon.
sessions.title: Live UX review

sessions.description: The design sprint is a process for prototyping and testing any product in 5 days. Using real-world examples, we’ll show how to move faster and increase the overall effectiveness (and happiness!) of your whole team. And we'll offer techniques for teams of any size, from two-person startup to giant enterprise.
sessions.title: The design sprint: from Google Ventures to Google X

sessions.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.
sessions.title: SDK tools for layouts

sessions.description: Think your app or game has what it takes to become a global hit? Get key insights into major international markets and trends of successful apps and games in those regions. Leverage these pro tips and best practices to expand your game to a global audience.
sessions.title: Going global with Google Play

sessions.description: The multi-device mobile app world presents huge opportunities for developers to connect with users, and Google Play is one of the richest and most competitive business ecosystems on the planet. Understand how to leverage the complete suite of Google products to make a great app, build your userbase, expand your app onto new device types, and reach people globally.
sessions.title: Google Play power session

sessions.description: ART is an evolution of the Android runtime, and was first made available as an option on Android 4.4, KitKat. It comes with improvements in the garbage collector, threading and locking model, compiler and runtime performance. In this session, we'll focus on all of the improvements we've been making to the Android runtime.
sessions.title: The ART runtime

sessions.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.
sessions.title: Jank-free performance audits

sessions.description: The web is getting new capabilities! In this tech talk we'll discuss some of the changes that are already available, such as background processing with Service Worker, and also give you a sneak peek at some new APIs we're testing out. Which APIs? You'll have to attend to find out. :) There are some cool demos in store for you and we'd love to get your feedback on our work as we test drive these new capabilities in the coming months.
sessions.title: Bridging the gap between the web and apps

sessions.description: Develop locally with Cloud SDK, store images on Google Cloud Storage, deploy containers into production.
sessions.title: Containers on Google App Engine

sessions.description: Pull up a chair and join the Android platform team for a fireside chat. It's your opportunity to ask us about the platform and learn a little bit more about why things work the way they do, from the people who built it. Moderated by Android Developer Advocate Reto Meier.
sessions.title: Android fireside chat

sessions.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.
sessions.title: Taking on accessibility challenges in complex web applications

sessions.description: Uncovering user needs is one of the most challenging aspects of product development. Oh-so-many organizations develop beautiful products and services nobody needs. The Experience Sampling Method is a simple research technique for uncovering user needs. In a typical Experience Sampling method, research participants are interrupted several times a day to note their experience in real time. In this talk, Tomer Sharon will demonstrate the method, describe how it has been applied at Google Search, and provide a short, practical how-to guide.
sessions.title: Don't Listen to Users, Sample Their Experience!

sessions.description: Overview of Google Play followed by a panel discussion with developers on the following topics: user acquisition, engagement and monetization.
sessions.title: How to get, keep and monetize users on Google Play

sessions.description: No one likes battery-draining apps. We’ve analyzed power use by the platform and apps and want to share what we've found in this talk. We will go over best power practices, and familiarize you with some tools for measuring power consumption. We'll also describe a couple APIs that make it easy for you to write applications that drain less battery. Join us in helping improve battery life for our users.
sessions.title: Android power performance primer

sessions.description: How do you redesign a product used by a billion people?  The Google Maps team recently launched their biggest redesign since the product was introduced 8 years ago.  The lead designers will take you through the journey, illustrating three lessons learned that can apply to any design and product development process.
sessions.title: Redesigning Google Maps

sessions.description: Learn from one another and prototype new Glassware. In this Design Sprint, we'll examine the principles behind great Glassware (apps for Glass) and put these principles to use immediately. Whether you are a designer or developer, participate in this interactive workshop to explore using Glass to transform how people interact with technology. Capacity: 100 people.
sessions.title: Glassware design sprint

sessions.description: Learn how Exit Live, a music startup, went "all in" with Dart: server-side and client-side. Exit Live engineers will teach you how they built the infrastructure and apps with Dart. Get expert answers and advice from engineers that launched their startup on Dart.
sessions.title: All-in: Using Dart for everything

sessions.description: Bring your own big data processing scenario, and let's see how Google's newest product for doing large scale data processing can help you clearly express and efficiently execute your pipeline.
sessions.title: Large scale data processing in the Cloud

sessions.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.
sessions.title: Request quest: Test your knowledge of obscure browser behavior

sessions.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.
sessions.title: Taking on accessibility challenges in complex web applications

sessions.description: Baffled by OAuth2, JWT, service accounts, credentials, and cloud projects? In this session we'll give you a quick start at authenticating with Google services and other APIs using OAuth.
sessions.title: Authentication and third party APIs

sessions.description: Hindsight is 20/20, especially when it applies to your own unsuccessful startup. Looking back at what happened with Tutorspree has taught me a lot of lessons that come in handy working with our startups at Y Combinator. These are some of the things I learned.
sessions.title: How crashing my startup taught me to work at Y Combinator

sessions.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.
sessions.title: Android accessibility updates

sessions.description: Bring along your smartphone website for a live review. Our reviews will be based on data that revealed best practices in mobile website design.
sessions.title: Smartphone websites: UX review

sessions.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.
sessions.title: Accessibility developer tools in Chrome

sessions.description: Designers at Google demonstrate some of their favorite tools for prototyping UIs.
sessions.title: Our favorite prototyping tools

sessions.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.
sessions.title: Android accessibility updates

sessions.description: Using Cassandra as an example, we'll walk through the steps we took to drive a 1 million requests / second benchmark against Google Cloud Platform.  Follow us on a deep dive into tuning the performance of VMs, Network and Block storage to make your NoSQL database scream in the Cloud.
sessions.title: Scaling NoSQL performance on Google Cloud Platform

sessions.description: In this session, Google designers will discuss motion design across multiple platforms.
sessions.title: Cross-platform motion design

sessions.description: Need to clean/format your Google-Analytics (GA) logs to import into your data-warehouse? Need to quickly and painlessly join your GA data with other data sources (CRM, YouTube)? Need to mine your GA data and create custom market segments? In this session, we will sketch how you can unlock all the potential in your GA logs by melding GA-Premium (no sampling!), BigQuery (fast insights) and BigData services.
sessions.title: Unlocking the potential of GoogleAnalytics logs using Google BigData services

sessions.description: Learn how Android and Google Play Games enable mobile games to bring players together.  Never before has there been such a diverse audience of people playing video games everywhere. This form of entertainment creates a social fabric that brings us together, and the ubiquity of mobile devices represents an evolution of that fabric.  We’ll discuss how developers are making successful experiences using games services, and how to enable engaging and exciting new game play scenarios whether your game has single player, multiplayer or community-like mechanics.
sessions.title: Play Games: Evolution of our beloved form of entertainment

sessions.description: We review your Android, Web, Google Cast, Glass, and Wear apps and provide live feedback. Details on nominating your app for review are coming soon.
sessions.title: Live UX review

sessions.description: In this hands-on workshop, you'll get practice with design techniques that you can use to gather data about customers, get your team focused on the same challenges, quickly sketch new ideas, and turn those sketches into prototypes. The Google Ventures design team has helped over 80 startups with these techniques. Now we're sharing what we've learned in this 2 hour crash course. No design experience necessary, just come ready to have fun. Capacity: 100 people.
sessions.title: Design sprints with Google Ventures

sessions.description: One of cloud's promises is to reduce your devops workload and allow your development to be more agile. In this session we will demo how to use the upcoming version of Google Cloud Release Pipelines to release your application through a multi-stage built/test/deployment pipeline. The Release Pipeline is based on tools you are already familiar with such as Jenkins, Maven and Git. Many of the repetitive tasks are automated so you can spend more time on your application. At the same time you will have visibility and control over how your application is released.
sessions.title: Continuous integration with Google Cloud Release Pipelines

sessions.description: Bring your own big data processing scenario, and let's see how Google's newest product for doing large scale data processing can help you clearly express and efficiently execute your pipeline.
sessions.title: Large scale data processing in the Cloud

sessions.description: Satellites have been systematically collecting imagery of our changing planet for more than 40 years, yet until recently this treasure trove of “big data” has not been online and available for high-performance data mining.   This session will cover the new Google Earth Engine technology and experimental API for massively-parallel geospatial analysis on daily-updating global datasets such as Landsat satellite imagery.  Scientists and other domain experts are developing new EE-powered applications which map, measure and monitor our changing planet in unprecedented detail, for the benefit of people and the environment.  Applications include tracking and reducing global deforestation; mapping and mitigating the risks of earthquakes and extreme weather events such as floods and drought; and even creating new kinds of geo-visualizations such as the 2014 Webby award-winning “Timelapse” - a zoomable, browsable HTML5 video animation of the entire Earth from 1984-2012, built from nearly a petabyte of Landsat data. These early results merely hint at what’s now possible.
sessions.title: Maps for good: Saving trees and saving lives with petapixel-scale computing

sessions.description: Learn how to take advantage of the graphics and animation capabilities of Android to create very rich and compelling applications.
sessions.title: Graphical Android: Rich effects for great user interfaces

sessions.description: Entering the multi-screen era means rethinking how we build our applications. Producing a few PSDs doesn't cut it anymore, we have to start seeing the things we design as components within larger systems. Join us to learn how to use Polymer to revolutionize your design process. With these new tools we can create the UIs of the future, and shorten the time between concept and reality.
sessions.title: Unlock the next era of UI development with Polymer

sessions.description: If you are collecting access logs from 100 web servers with >100K req/s, how do you draw a graph of req/s from the logs for last 12 months and update it every 3 sec? You'd need a design pattern called "Lambda Architecture", a combination of real-time and big data processing. In this session, we will show how you can take advantage of the power of Docker to deploy a large scale LA in 10 min with BigQuery and Complex Event Processing (CEP) tool.
sessions.title: Building a Lambda Architecture in 10 minutes with BigQuery, CEP and Docker

sessions.description: Over one billion people worldwide live with a disability and rely on technology for everyday services that many take for granted. Learn how to make your web and Android applications more accessible from experts who are leading Accessibility efforts at Google.
sessions.title: Android custom views

sessions.description: In this session, Google designers discuss visual design across multiple platforms. They'll dive deeply into grid systems, color palettes, iconography, typography, and the usage of photography and illustration.
sessions.title: Cross-platform visual design and imagery

sessions.description: Get hands on training with Qualcomm’s Adreno graphics tools through a case study of profiling and performance optimization of a commercial game of your choice. Bring your games/graphics applications and we will help you profile them at the session!
sessions.title: Qualcomm tooling and performance

sessions.description: Learn the key architecture patterns behind the largest games built on Google Cloud Platform.
sessions.title: Massively scalable backends for MMO and mobile games

sessions.description: Meet with performance minded engineers for Unity Technologies! This session will present techniques for making high performance games for Android using Unity. Techniques will range from general tips for working with Unity to in depth CPU and GPU optimizations. Bring your Unity project and get expert help and hints on making the best games!
sessions.title: Unity tooling and performance

sessions.description: Get an inside look at how Google designers approach the process of concepting and developing the latest generation of Google products by leveraging capabilities of the platform.
sessions.title: Inspirational design

sessions.description: Learn how the Dart VM can be embedded onto devices, and how Dart can be used to build responsive UIs for TVs, directly from engineers working on Google Fiber. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.
sessions.title: Building set-top box UIs with Dart

sessions.description: In this session Brad Fitzpatrick will talk about writing Go code that runs in a variety of environments: from the command line to the cloud to your pocket.
sessions.title: Camlistore: Android, ARM, App Engine, everywhere

sessions.description: Built on Google’s developer platform, Santa Tracker lets millions of children and adults track Santa in 34 languages as he delivers presents across the world. The project’s technical leads go behind the scenes to provide insight into the challenges of building a cohesive Google developer platform experience across mobile/desktop web, Android, Chromecast, Maps and Search; all powered by a Go AppEngine backend.
sessions.title: How 20% engineers built Santa Tracker

sessions.description: How do you make your cloud applications fast? For the past 15 years, Google have been developing tools and techniques for building fast cloud based services - something that we like to think of as ‘Google-Fast’.  In this session we’ll look at how we build Google Search, Google Maps and Gmail to be Google-Fast. We’ll demonstrate how you can apply much of what we’ve learned to building your own fast cloud services and applications using the tools and services available to you with Google Cloud Platform. We’ll provide deeper insight on how to get the best performance out of all of your cloud resources, from Persistent Disk performance to Cloud Datastore writes and beyond. You’ll leave this session fully equipped to design and build Google-Fast cloud applications on Google Cloud Platform.
sessions.title: Making your cloud apps Google-fast

sessions.description: Wearable technology requires new design approaches. We'll share our design process for Android Wear and Glass, and tips for developers and designers working in this emerging space.
sessions.title: Designing for wearables

sessions.description: Researchers and designers focusing on accessibility share some considerations for designing accessible apps and web sites.
sessions.title: #AccessibilityMatters

sessions.description: Do you run applications in the cloud? How well do you understand what they’re doing? Is Redis overheating? Are all of your Hadoop nodes healthy? Did you notice that spike in errors that you were serving at 3am? Because your users sure did. Luckily, we can help. We’ll show you how you can use Google Cloud Platform’s powerful logging, monitoring, and alerting capabilities to quickly recognize when your applications aren’t behaving or performing well. It’s easy to set up, and it’s easy to use. We’ll demonstrate the integration of Stackdriver’s monitoring and alerting system with the Google Cloud Platform. When you leave this talk, you’ll understand how you can start using our intelligent monitoring, which lets you spend less time on ops and more time developing the next great cloud app!
sessions.title: Taming your cloud applications with intelligent monitoring

sessions.description: How can we  answer questions about the quality of an experience? Do people like it? Is it fun? The most common measurements we use are quantitative, but how do we evaluate the quality of a design? How can we measure subjective experiences such as "intuitive", "understandable", or "frustrating"? You will learn research & analysis methods, and collaborate on hands-on exercises to apply these methods to your own designs and products. Capacity: 100 people.
sessions.title: You want me to measure what?! Turning qualitative information into quantitative data

sessions.description: Now that App Engine is using Gradle in Android Studio, we'll go over how the gradle-appengine-plugin works and how to make it work for you.
sessions.title: Building App Engine with Gradle in Android Studio

sessions.description: Docker is gaining a lot of traction as a way to make deploying applications on Cloud Platforms easier. This session will take a look at how we can build tooling around Docker, Docker containers to improve the application lifecycle for Developers.
sessions.title: Developer workflow around Docker containers

sessions.description: Make your NDK app faster in real-time with performance optimization using Intel Graphics Performance Analyzers and Intel Vtune Amplifier. Intel's experts will be onsite, profiling real games and identifying performance opportunities.
sessions.title: Intel tooling and performance

sessions.description: Need to clean/format your Google-Analytics (GA) logs to import into your data-warehouse? Need to quickly and painlessly join your GA data with other data sources (CRM, YouTube)? Need to mine your GA data and create custom market segments? In this session, we will sketch how you can unlock all the potential in your GA logs by melding GA-Premium (no sampling!), BigQuery (fast insights) and BigData services.
sessions.title: Unlocking the potential of GoogleAnalytics logs using Google BigData services

sessions.description: We all want our apps to be loved by our users. We all strive to create the perfect design which users will like – ultimately love, want to use repeatedly and never abandon. Sounds like a love story? Sure it is! Why? It is because our users actually do fall in love with great applications by using unconscious mating patterns when they interact with the applications we distribute. So, if you want to better design an app which will be easily distributed, you must understand the relationship between humans and apps. This is what this talk is all about! In this presentation, you will be introduced to the framework for creating applications which are attractive and appealing. You will learn some tips for how to design apps which will instantly catch the user’s attention – call it love at first sight --, be fun to use and be less prone to be abandoned. Now, don’t we all want to create such applications?
sessions.title: Distributing appealing apps: How to make them love your apps!

sessions.description: Google Play Product and Business Development Managers will be turning the tables back to you, and asking developers their thoughts and suggestions on business critical topics.
sessions.title: Google Play flipped panel

sessions.description: Industry designers share their opinions on design in today's multi-device world, design workflow, and more.
sessions.title: Design community panel

sessions.description: A huge opportunity is brewing. One where web development becomes a powerfully rich ecosystem of discoverable, sharable, and reusable components. Polymer is the first library of its kind to fully embrace this brave new web platform. In this session we’ll reveal the latest with Polymer, what Polymer is doing to create an end-to-end workflow for developers and their users, unveil the burgeoning ecosystem of web components, and demonstrate the next generation of web apps. The web components revolution is here. Join us in building the future!
sessions.title: Polymer and the Web Components revolution

sessions.description: Come and talk to our Google Play team.
sessions.title: Google Play office hours

sessions.description: Cloud Services help developers succeed by letting them focus on building great apps and user experiences. Today, developers rely on Google Cloud Messaging to deliver messages to their Android users. We're releasing an exciting set of new features to inspire our developers to achieve even more, including upstream messaging, GCM for Chrome, and more.
sessions.title: Achieving more with Mobile Cloud

sessions.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.
sessions.title: 5 Chrome DevTool tricks for a faster mobile website

sessions.description: The NVIDIA Developer Tools team will demonstrate how to optimize NDK Android applications with a comprehensive set of Graphics and CPU performance scenarios. This presentation will cover newly released tools for developers to take advantage of Tegra K1, with the Kepler GPU core, and demonstrate a variety of performance limited situations created with Croteam’s Serious Sam III game engine.
sessions.title: NVIDIA tooling and performance

sessions.description: Web Components give developers better encapsulation, reuse, and extensibility. Learn how to build and use Web Components built with Polymer, and combine both JavaScript and Dart components into a single app. Get expert answers and advice from Dart engineers.
sessions.title: Using Polymer with Dart and JavaScript

sessions.description: In this panel, Google designers will share their thoughts on designing for multiple platforms.
sessions.title: Cross-platform design panel

sessions.description: Build the best version of your app. Come learn tips and tricks for building truly great Android apps - get the most out of Android Studio’s design tools, master the intricacies of Gradle, tune your client performance with procstats and systrace, simplify your backend with Google Play services, and more. Android experts will be on hand to tear down your app … and then rebuild it. We have the technology.
sessions.title: GC and Jank in Art

sessions.description: A panel of high-profile game developers share insights on how to develop successful titles for Android. Hear their approach to user acquisition and engagement; learn about the role of Google Play games services in their Android strategy.
sessions.title: Google Play Games: A developer perspective

sessions.description: Find out how you can use Google Cloud Platform development tools to discover, analyze and fix problems affecting your production application - all without leaving your browser.
sessions.title: Putting out fires in your production application

sessions.description:
Do you need simple, flexible, and powerful ways to process data of any size and from different sources? In this session we unveil a new system that enables you to rapidly build and execute data pipelines which can be used to ingest huge volumes of streaming data while simultaneously performing continuous, near-real-time analytics. You’ll learn how you can easily build complex data pipelines that can be used to seamlessly cross the data processing boundaries from batch to streaming, all on a system that is fully managed and optimized within the Google Cloud Platform. 
Come see how easy it is for you to move beyond just Big data and equip yourself with all the tools that you need to move into the world of ‘Fast Data’
sessions.title: The dawn of "Fast Data"

sessions.description: Ignite is a series of five-minute presentations for geeks. Each speaker gets 20 slides that auto-advance after 15 seconds. Come prepared to for rapid-fire ideas from all over the world.
sessions.title: Ignite

sessions.description: Walk right up, we're doing 480 minutes of demos on the latest of the web platform in Chrome. See the latest profiling advancements in the Chrome DevTools, explore cross-platform cross-compilation with pepper.js, the future of web development with Polymer and ramping you up on the latest best practices for successfully building for the mobile web.  Come by the booth if you want a few knowledge bombs and talk to Chrome team engineers who can help you improve how you develop for the web.
sessions.title: Optimizing the mobile experience with PageSpeed insights

sessions.description: Get hands on training with Qualcomm’s Adreno graphics tools through a case study of profiling and performance optimization of a commercial game of your choice. Bring your games/graphics applications and we will help you profile them at the session!
sessions.title: Qualcomm tooling and performance

video_library.title: Google I/O 2013 Keynote
video_library.desc: Google I/O 2013 Keynote

video_library.title: Google I/O 2012 Keynote, day 1
video_library.desc: Google I/O 2012 Keynote, day 1

video_library.title: Google I/O 2012 Keynote, day 2
video_library.desc: Google I/O 2012 Keynote, day 2

video_library.title: What's New in Android Developer Tools

video_library.speakers: Sara Sinclair Brody, Rich Hyndman, Matthew Xie
video_library.title: Best Practices for Bluetooth Development
video_library.desc: Opinions on Bluetooth can divide a crowd, but the technology can connect them back together. This is an end-to-end session that gives a brief overview of core specifications and profiles before diving into Android Bluetooth support, best practices for development (with examples), and some features you may not be aware of.

video_library.speakers: Dan Galpin, Jaewoong Jung, Jennie Lees
video_library.title: Games Services in Practice
video_library.desc: Practical tips for game developers from insiders within the Android team, including how to work with the developer dashboard from the beginning of development through multiple releases.

video_library.title: Volley: Easy, Fast Networking for Android
video_library.desc: Volley is a library that makes networking for Android apps easier and most importantly, faster. We'll give an overview of how it works, common patterns that work well with it, and a walkthrough of how you can easily load thumbnail images for your ListView from the network in parallel.

video_library.title: Androids Do Daydream
video_library.desc: With Daydream, new in Android 4.2, an idle or docked device becomes an opportunity for your app to delight the user. But where did this feature come from? Should your app support Daydream? How easy is it to add a Daydream? How can you make yours more fun and engaging? Answers to these questions—plus plenty of ideas and sample code—will be provided for daydreamers attending this session.

video_library.title: Level Up Your Android Game
video_library.desc: Learn how to take your game to the next level on Google Play. Our annual game talk, with ways to power up your distribution, user acquisition, and retention. Earn the “Gold Rush” achievement. Score three stars in quality and be one of the featured games on Google Play.

video_library.speakers: Todd Kerpelman, Steve Martin, David Santoro
video_library.title: New Developments in Mobile Gaming
video_library.desc: Hey, mobile game developers! Wondering what Google's been working on to make life better for you? Drop by the New Developments in Mobile Gaming talk and hear about the latest features we've been building to give your mobile games a little extra moxie.

video_library.title: Writing Custom Views for Android
video_library.desc: While the Android framework provides a number of layouts and prebuilt composable pieces for building UIs, targeted optimization or building unique hero moments often means writing custom views. We'll show you how the measurement and layout process works and patterns for advanced touch processing.

video_library.speakers: Bruno Oliveira, Wolff Dobson, Dan Rodney
video_library.title: Mobile Multiplayer Made Manageable
video_library.desc: From infrastructure to game logic, writing a multi-player game can be challenging. We will look at techniques to solve common problems when writing multi-player games for Android.

video_library.title: Advanced Game Development Topics
video_library.desc: For game developers who want to dive into more advanced scenarios. Learn about new ways to integrate with Google+, implement and manage game states in a safe way and creating cool game experiences through select Google REST APIs. We will also cover new NDK topics, as well as using 3rd-party game engines.

video_library.title: In-App Billing Version 3
video_library.desc: Thousands of developers monetize apps on Google Play through try-and-buy, virtual goods, as well as subscriptions. Learn how to leverage the more robust (and simpler!) new generation of the Android in-app billing API that makes implementations easier to write and maintain. Familiarity with earlier versions not required. We will cover: availability, purchase flow, subscriptions, consumption models, and security best practices.

video_library.title: WebM and the New VP9 Open Video Codec
video_library.desc: According to Cisco, video data will be 55 percent of all consumer Internet traffic by 2016. With that much data traversing networks, efficient video compression will be more important than ever, especially on mobile networks. We are very excited about the new VP9 codec, which delivers better video quality at lower data rates than competing technologies. Furthermore, VP9 was developed entirely in the open as a royalty-free technology. In this session you will learn how VP9 performs against H.264 and other other codecs in quality and decoding speed, how to create WebM videos with VP9 and the new Opus audio codec, and how to deploy VP9 content to Chrome users in HTML5 <video>. </video>

video_library.title: Use Apps Script to Create Dynamic Google Forms
video_library.desc: The updated version of Google Forms that launched earlier this year works with Apps Script, allowing you to create and manipulate forms with only a few lines of code. In this session, we'll explore ways to make forms and workflows more useful through scripts and demonstrate tricks that make forms react to changes in your organization.

video_library.title: Actions in the inbox, powered by schemas
video_library.desc: Does your service send emails? During this session we will show you how to add structured data to your emails to enable actions directly from the inbox and increase user engagement.

video_library.title: A Trip Down Memory Lane with Gmail and DevTools
video_library.desc: Automatic garbage collection in JavaScript isn't a substitute for effective memory management, especially in large, long-running web apps.  Memory leaks, frequent garbage collection pauses, and overall memory bloat can really drag you down.  Come take a trip down memory lane with us and learn how we tackled these performance issues in Gmail.  We'll share best practices for memory management and demonstrate how to use the Chrome DevTools Heap Profiler like a wizard to optimize your site.

video_library.title: The Chrome Packaged Apps State of the Nation
video_library.desc: Happy birthday Chrome Packaged Apps! Come help us celebrate by learning what's new in the Packaged Apps platform and what's ahead on the roadmap.

video_library.title: Getting the Most Out of Google+ in Your Organization
video_library.desc: Google Apps is a cloud-based productivity suite that helps your team get work done from anywhere on any device. By adding the power of Google+ for business, your team can connect and share seamlessly with coworkers and external partners. In this session, we will review the unique features of Google+ for business, discuss new ways of integrating Google+ into your business systems and processes, and help you get the most out of Google+ to facilitate easy, quick and compelling communication across your organization.

video_library.title: What's New with the Google Drive SDK: One Year Later
video_library.desc: This talk will discuss the latest features of the Drive SDK that have been developed as part of Google’s commitment to allow 3rd parties to write Drive applications with the richness of Google Docs/Sheets/Presentations. These features make it easier to find files, receive notifications when files change, and publish websites.

video_library.title: Jank Free: Chrome Rendering Performance
video_library.desc: Animations and scrolling at 60FPS: difficult! Let's talk about rendering performance by way of a couple case studies. We'll cover the basic challenge of smooth animation, approaches to finding the bottleneck in your application using Dev Tools, and methods to cope with some common pitfalls. Topics include Dev Tools rendering features, subtleties of CSS animation, common cases that kill scrolling performance, and a peak into the hardware acceleration model that underpins Chrome's graphics pipeline.

video_library.title: A More Awesome Web: Features You've Always Wanted
video_library.desc: The web continues to evolve at an accelerated rate. It's hard to keep up! This session will cover the bleeding-edge features of HTML5 that you may have missed, focusing on features that make developers' lives easier and apps more powerful. A heavy focus will be on freshly landed CSS/JS/HTML primitives which address layout, performance, and specific use cases...especially on mobile: @viewport, @supports, intrinsic/viewport units, resolution & pointer media queries, User/Resource Timing APIs, JS i18n API, iframe goodies, <template>, <dialog>, and more.</dialog>

video_library.title: The Modern Workflow for Developing the Mobile Web
Mobile, Web and Cloud - The Triple Crown of Modern Applications
video_library.desc: Ready to rock the world with your next application?  Odds are you are thinking about mobile, web and the cloud. In this session we will walk through building a modern mobile web application that takes advantage of the Google Cloud Platform.  Learn trips, best practices and solid architecture that will make your next mobile web app an amazing success.

video_library.speakers: Charles Chen, Volker Sorge, David Tseng
video_library.title: Advancing Web Accessibility with ChromeVox
JAM with Chrome: How We Built a Massive Multiplayer Music Application Using Only Web Technology
video_library.desc: Built by the Creative Labs team in London, Jam with Chrome was a hugely successful Chrome experiment that allowed users to form a band from nearly anywhere in the world and "Jam" like stars in near real-time. We will show you how we built Jam with Chrome using the latest web technologies and give you practical advice and guidance on how you can do the same. We will focus on the Real time WebSockets component, the session management system, and the music engine made using the Web Audio API--come learn how to "Jam."

video_library.speakers: Bryan McQuade, Doantam Phan, Mona Vajihollahi
video_library.title: Instant Mobile Websites: Techniques and Best Practices
video_library.desc: Users expect a fast and optimized experience regardless of whether they're on a mobile or desktop browser. However, delivering a fast mobile experience requires careful consideration and engineering: you need to optimize your network access, you need to prioritize critical assets to deliver the best visual rendering performance, and you need to adapt your pages to the capabilities of the device (such as smaller viewport, touch, high-resolution screens, etc.). In this session we will take a deep technical dive into the criteria that affect the performance of your sites on mobile browsers, and discuss how you can optimize your site to deliver the best experience to your users.

video_library.title: Design Decisions in AngularJS
video_library.desc: We'll cover the design decisions that drove creating AngularJS, the JavaScript framework that combines data binding, reusable components, dependency injection, and a host of other powerful capabilities for building modern web applications. Come join us and learn how to build extremely scalable applications that are fast to build, trivial to change and maintain, easy to test, and that clearly express your intent to all developers on your team.

video_library.title: Using Drive as the Storage Solution on Android
video_library.desc: How you can use save files on Android and let the Drive SDK deal with the messy details of uploading it to the cloud, and having it available and synchronised on all devices.

video_library.title: Automating Performance Best Practices with PageSpeed
Standardizing Payments on the Web: Introducing requestAutocomplete()
video_library.desc: Ever try buying something on the mobile web? Combine a mess of form fields and a soft keyboard and it's more frustrating than it needs to be. How many customers don’t buy things from you because doing so is just too much work?  requestAutocomplete() is an aspiring web standard that will allow users to bypass pages of form fields with an imperative API for requesting details the browser knows. In this session we'll highlight how to enhance your site with requestAutocomplete(), how to quickly implement the feature, and what to consider when optimizing the UX of your ecommerce experience.

video_library.speakers: Alex Komoroske, Paul Irish, Max Heinritz, Eric Seidel
video_library.title: Fireside Chat with the Blink Team
Google+ Platform Overview
video_library.desc: Join us for an overview of the whole Google+ platform. Learn what Google+ has to offer your applications, where the platform is headed, and determine your must see Google+ platform sessions at I/O this year.

video_library.title: An Introduction to Integrating Google+ Sign-In
video_library.desc: Whether you have a website, mobile app, game, or other online service, users can now sign in with Google and bring along their Google+ profile. Come learn how Google+ Sign-In can create more engaging experiences in your app and drive more usage across devices.  This talk will introduce the technical concepts of integrating Google+ Sign-In and other Google+ features, and is a pre-requisite for other Google+ talks.

video_library.title: Google+ for Publishers: Buttons, Badges, and More
video_library.desc: Google+ offers a suite of tools for publishers that help users share and discover content on their site, both on the site itself and when coming from Google properties like Google Search.  In this session, we'll cover all the basics of the Google+ tools that can help drive discovery and engagement on your website.

video_library.title: G+ and Search: How to Enhance Your Brand Queries on Google
video_library.desc: In this session we'll walk you through a series of techniques you can use to make your app and content shine on Google. Using these techniques you can connect more directly with new and existing users on Google Search.

video_library.title: The Google+ Hangouts API a Year Later: Much More than a Virtual Mustache
video_library.desc: The Hangout Apps platform has evolved steadily over the last year. Hear how far we've come, learn how you can make your apps come alive with audio/video conversations & see what's up next for the technology.

video_library.title: Getting the Most Out of Google+ in Your Organization
video_library.desc: Google Apps is a cloud-based productivity suite that helps your team get work done from anywhere on any device. By adding the power of Google+ for business, your team can connect and share seamlessly with coworkers and external partners. In this session, we will review the unique features of Google+ for business, discuss new ways of integrating Google+ into your business systems and processes, and help you get the most out of Google+ to facilitate easy, quick and compelling communication across your organization.

video_library.title: Cloud Platform Track Kickoff: Ushering in the Next Generation of Cloud Computing
video_library.desc: Senior Vice President Urs Hölzle will share Google’s vision for the next generation of cloud computing.  He’ll discuss how investments in infrastructure, software and people will help usher in this new era for Google and developers around the world via the Google Cloud Platform.  This session will also include announcements and demo important new features of the Platform.

video_library.title: Autoscaling Java
video_library.desc: Understand how to build Java applications that work well in an autoscaling environment.  We'll discuss common anti-patterns in Java that make it difficult for autoscaling environments to deal with your application.  We'll also discuss how App Engine knows when to scale up and back your application and how to take full advantage of this.

video_library.title: Importing Large Data Sets into Google Cloud Storage
video_library.desc: This session will review multiple approaches customers take when importing their large data sets into Google Cloud Storage, including trade-offs in time, cost, and complexity. These solutions include several advanced techniques which will also help you in a wide range of other situations. We'll show the architecture and code for some of these approaches and feature a case study of a 5 PB+ migration.

video_library.speakers: Martin Gannholm, Navneet Joneja, Sebastian Stadil
video_library.title: What's New and Cool with Google Compute Engine
video_library.desc: Google Compute Engine's had a very busy year! We've made improvements to the underlying architecture to provide even better performance, released new versions of our APIs that improve the developer experience, and introduced many new features and instance types. Come join us as we guide you through what's new and cool with Google Compute Engine, and how recent improvements can help you build more efficient, scalable and cost-effective applications in the cloud.

video_library.title: Mobile, Web and Cloud - The Triple Crown of Modern Applications
video_library.desc: Ready to rock the world with your next application?  Odds are you are thinking about mobile, web and the cloud. In this session we will walk through building a modern mobile web application that takes advantage of the Google Cloud Platform.  Learn trips, best practices and solid architecture that will make your next mobile web app an amazing success.

video_library.title: Supercharge Your Google Compute Engine App with Persistent Disk
video_library.desc: The performance, reliability and consistency of Persistent Disk (PD) are part of what distinguishes GCE as a next generation cloud service.  Discover some of the internals of PD and what distinguishes it from comparable offerings.  This session will include a technical deep dive into best practices for using PD with your GCE apps.

video_library.title: Google Maps: Into the Future
video_library.desc: Google Maps and the Maps API enjoy huge popularity around the world. The Google Maps API is the most used API on the web. maps.google.com is the most used mapping site. Android and iOS SDKs are branching Maps out into new platforms. In this session, the Product Management Director of Google Maps teams with the Product Manager for the Google Maps API and the lead Developer Advocate to walk you into the future of Google Maps.

video_library.title: The Next Frontier: Indoor Maps
video_library.desc: Mapping streets and buildings is the hard part. But the even harder part is mapping indoors. Not only is Google acquiring floor plans for major buildings and venues, but we’re also working out ways to provide positioning data inside those buildings. When GPS doesn’t work, how do you find your place on the map?

video_library.title: Design Patterns for Maps - Architecture
video_library.desc: Spatial data architectures are many and varied. There are simple solutions that host static data, and complex integrations with existing enterprise infrastructures, and everything inbetween. But common patterns - and antipatterns - emerge regarding how data is hosted and served to your users. This session will discuss those patterns and how you can implement them in your mapping architecture.

video_library.title: Design Principles for Maps
video_library.desc: What is the user interface for your map? How do you put together a UI that allows easy access to your data? Does the design of your map help your users get the data they need? This talk will help developers bring together the elements of visual design, cartography, and user experience to help present their mapping data in the best way.

video_library.title: Making Location Meaningful with the Google Maps APIs
video_library.desc: Location is a fundamental aspect of many location-based apps. But knowing where your user is located is only part of the story. Knowing where they’re going and where they’ve been can fundamentally alter what you present to them. This session will explore using aspects of location to present a richer experience for users.

video_library.title: The Other Mobile Mapping Platform: Getting Your Maps into iOS
video_library.desc: In December, Google launched the Google Maps SDK for iOS. With vector maps that allow a much wider range of motion and access to Google Map data and imagery, the SDK provides a powerful way for you to build iOS apps on your platform. This session will explore different ways for you to integrate your data with a Google Maps experience.

video_library.title: Project Ground Truth: Accurate Maps Via Algorithms and Elbow Grease
video_library.desc: In 2008, Google began project Ground Truth. Its goal was to map the world from authoritative data sources, via a unique mix of algorithms and elbow grease. To date, the project has created and launched high-quality map data of 42 countries in Google Maps. In this session, you'll get a behind-the-scenes look at the inner workings of Ground Truth. Come see how we combine a mix of advanced algorithms, supplemental data (such as aerial and Street View imagery), as well as raw human labor to create and maintain map data that corresponds as closely as possible to real-world truth on the ground.

video_library.speakers: Shiva Rajaraman, Andy Berkheimer, Jussi Laakkonen
video_library.title: YouTube for Developers: The Future and the Opportunities
video_library.desc: YouTube API is Google's largest API by request volume yet there are still a lot of apps that are not taking advantage of it. Join YouTube platform product and engineering leaders as they give you an overview of where YouTube is headed, give you a sneak peak at the latest YouTube APIs, and talk about opportunities for developers. We will also watch a few cool videos.

video_library.title: Ad hoc YouTube Analytics with Google Apps Script
video_library.desc: In this talk attendees will learn all about the new YouTube Analytics API. We will show the audience how to access the data via Google Apps Script, a cloud scripting platform. We will build and demo ad hoc reporting that extracts parametrized data via the YouTube Analytics API into Google Sheets. We'll also show how some of the reporting can be scheduled and alerts can be fired when thresholds are met. This talk will be of interest to YouTube publishers and also to developers looking to do more with Google Apps Scripts and Google Sheets.

video_library.title: Semantic Video Annotations in the YouTube Topics API: Theory and Applications
video_library.desc: Did you know that YouTube automatically classifies videos based on the Freebase Open Knowledge Graph topics that they relate to? We'll talk more about how we pull off this feat of classification, as well as how you can use topics to power YouTube API searches or find related videos.

video_library.title: Mobile Development With YouTube APIs: Best Practices
video_library.desc: YouTube recently launched several new APIs (Data API V3, Analytics API, Android Player API) and mobile developers have much easier time integrating the world's video platform into their application. Learn about the best practices and see cool examples from innovators in this area.

video_library.title: YouTube API Push Notifications
video_library.desc: Tired of polling for updates to YouTube API feeds? Wouldn't it be nicer if the API could tell your application when new data were available? Come and hear about our new YouTube API push notification infrastructure, and find out how you can write code that responds to new YouTube activities.

video_library.title: Super-Charge Your Mobile Game with YouTube
video_library.desc: Leading gaming developers are integrating with YouTube to make their games go viral. You could be next. In this session will will show you how to take a Unity3D game and super-charge it with YouTube uploads, in-game YouTube playback and convert the YouTube users into players of your title.

video_library.speakers: Michael Galpin, Prakash Hariramani, Jonathan Taylor
video_library.title: Selling physical goods on Android with Google Wallet Instant Buy
video_library.desc: One of the top barrier to mobile commerce is the ease of checkout. Whether you're selling office supplies, t-shirts, or fancy jewelry your users are faced with the same problem: providing credit card and shipping information via long complicated forms that are particularly painful to fill out on a mobile device. That's where the Google Wallet Android API comes in. Learn how you can use the API to make the shopping experience in your app simple and frictionless, and in turn drive up conversion and sales.

video_library.speakers: pali bhat, Nik Sathe, David Singleton
video_library.title: Digitizing The Entire Wallet: Introducing Wallet Objects
video_library.desc: Wallet Objects is a simple, powerful platform that makes commerce more efficient by digitizing and storing commercial objects (offers, loyalty cards) in Google Wallet and enabling stronger 3rd party issuer-consumer relationships. In this session, we will walk you through the spec and code to insert objects into Google Wallet, making a smarter wallet for consumers.

video_library.title: Redefining Loyalty In The Mobile Age
video_library.desc: In this session, we will introduce you to the Wallet Objects Loyalty API.  Learn how you can integrate your loyalty programs into Google Wallet and make it available to millions of users to discover. Drive engagement of your loyalty program by enabling users to use Google Wallet to show and use their loyalty card, check their loyalty/reward point balances and much more.

video_library.speakers: Jon Boekenoogen, John Stuppy, Haisoo Shin
video_library.title: Building Compelling mCommerce Experiences on Android
video_library.desc: Building a mobile commerce Android app isn't just a matter of putting pictures of your products in a ListView and adding a buy button. More so than any other type of mobile apps, time is money. The longer you make a user wait or the more time you make them spend filling out forms will decrease the chance of the user finishing their transaction. Plus whenever you're talking about accepting payments, you must think about security as well. Learn some of the techniques and tips from the Google Wallet team and from one of our partner on how you can make your mobile commerce apps easier and more secure to use, and thus increase your conversions and ultimately your bottom line. This session will include some intermediate/advanced Android development topics.

video_library.title: Actions in the inbox, powered by schemas
video_library.desc: Does your service send emails? During this session we will show you how to add structured data to your emails to enable actions directly from the inbox and increase user engagement.

video_library.title: G+ and Search: How to Enhance Your Brand Queries on Google
video_library.desc: In this session we'll walk you through a series of techniques you can use to make your app and content shine on Google. Using these techniques you can connect more directly with new and existing users on Google Search.

video_library.title: Identity Tech Overview: Less Pain, More Gain
video_library.desc: Identity is hard, but the penalties for getting it wrong are severe. Good news: technologies are surfacing that reduce developer pain while improving user experience. This talk highlights them and introduces a framework, starting from your unique combination of constraints, users, and platforms, to help you figure out which technologies and policies will work for you.

video_library.title: Online Learning Made Social with Google+
video_library.desc: Come learn about how Google+ is helping Online learning platforms help connect students to each other and to professors. This talk will give an overview of the Google+ technologies that can be used in online education and also look at various examples of where this has been integrated successfully. You will also hear from Coursera, one of the leading Online Learning platforms and their experience with Google+ Hangouts.

video_library.title: Ingress: Design Principles Behind Google's Massively Multiplayer Geo Game

video_library.speakers: Jean Wang, Anna Patterson, diane greene, Kathy Kleiman, Megan Smith, Johanna Wright, Susan Wojcicki
video_library.title: 7 Techmakers and a Microphone

video_library.speakers: Derek Slater, Jeremy Robbins, Mike McGeary, Kevin Callahan, Jen Pahlka
video_library.title: Beyond SOPA: What You Can Do to Influence Tech Policy
Android Protips: Making Apps Work Like Magic
video_library.desc: Learn how to use advanced Android techniques to build apps so good, people think they're magic. Featuring advanced coding tips and tricks, implementation patterns, and exposure to some of the lesser-known APIs, you'll gain insight into how to build context sensitive apps that delight your users without draining their battery.

video_library.title: Google+ Sign-In for Android Developers
video_library.desc: Learn how to add Google+ Sign-In to your Android app, grow your installed base using OTA installs, drive more engagement using interactive posts, and monitor your apps' performance on Google+.

video_library.speakers: Reto Meier, Rich Hyndman, Jeff Hamilton
video_library.title: What's New in Google Play Services
video_library.desc: A high-level view of everything that's now available as part of Google Play services since it's launch, with a special focus on how this affects you as a developer - and what you should be paying attention to.

video_library.title: Google Cloud Messaging
video_library.desc: Google Cloud Messaging allows your services to efficiently send data to applications on Android devices. See what's new, and learn how to use GCM to make your apps more efficient.

video_library.title: Android Graphics Performance
video_library.desc: Engineers from the Android UI Graphics team will show some tips, tricks, tools, and techniques for getting the best performance and smoothest UI for your Android applications.

video_library.speakers: Brad Abrams, David Chandler, Grzegorz Gogolowicz
video_library.title: From Nothing to Nirvana in Minutes: Cloud Backend for Your Android Application
High Performance Audio
video_library.desc: It’s not that hard to play a background soundtrack in your mobile game app, or to play short clips of sound in response to user actions. But how about responsive reliable audio, that doesn’t glitch, works well across a range of devices, and doesn’t eat up your user’s battery? Oh, and is lower latency too? It turns out that’s not so easy. We’ll share our own experiences with the Android platform and apps, discuss the problem areas and the work we’ve been doing in the platform, and give some techniques you can apply now in your own apps. We assume you’re familiar with OpenSL ES and audio terminology.

video_library.speakers: Reto Meier, Rachel Garb, Dave Burke, Xavier Ducrohet, Dan Morrill, Dianne Hackborn, Ficus Kirkpatrick, Romain Guy, Adam Powell, Jeff Hamilton, Rebecca Zavin
video_library.title: Fireside Chat with the Android Team

video_library.speakers: Casey Burkhardt, Alan Viverette, T.V. Raman
video_library.title: Enabling Blind and Low-Vision Accessibility On Android
video_library.desc: We'll illustrate affordances on the Android platform that aid blind and low-vision users, and explain what application developers need to pay attention to in order to reach the widest possible user base.  The primary focus of this talk is making custom Android views accessible.

video_library.title: Beyond the Blue Dot: New Features in Android Location
video_library.desc: Location is not only at the heart of maps, but increasingly it's becoming critical to a new generation of contextual apps that are more aware of where the user is and what they're doing. Join us as we explore some of the new applications these APIs make possible.

video_library.title: Enchant, Simplify, Amaze: Android's Design Principles
video_library.desc: Want to enchant people, simplify their lives, and make them feel amazing with your app? Learn how Android's Design Principles can help you create products that resonate with people. Find out about the meaning and research behind the principles. See real-world examples and practices from the Android Design team. Discover techniques for applying the principles in your daily work. No design experience necessary.

video_library.title: Agile UX Research Practice in Android
video_library.desc: In the Android UX team, it is critical to get user feedback frequently and consistently so that we are able to iterate and develop the best-in-class designs for our users.  We will discuss how the team applied "Pulse Studies" (iterative research sessions) in order to put new ideas, designs, and concepts in front of users on a regular basis; it requires minimal advance planning, it can have an immediate product impact, and it can meet urgent needs.  We will illustrate how we accomplished this collaborative process by presenting rich examples and case studies.  We will also demonstrate usability study role playing in order to give you tips and tricks on how to adopt this process for anyone who is interested in getting user feedback in a quick and impactful way.

video_library.title: Structure in Android App Design
video_library.desc: Life is simple when your app is simple. But when your apps gets more complex, how do you choose between spinners, tabs, and drawers for navigation? Members of the Android Design team look at techniques for making your app predictable and pleasing to use.

video_library.title: When Android Meets Maps
video_library.desc: Build intuitive and compelling mobile map apps with the Google Maps Android API. This session will demonstrate innovative ways to integrate maps and Android sensors with Google services on Android. We will explore concepts on visualizing contextual, personalized and timely information.

video_library.title: A Moving Experience
video_library.desc: This talk will show various types of application animations and the code for how to achieve them. Developers should leave the presentation (not too quickly!) with more knowledge about how Android animations work, how to use the APIs effectively, and how to pull together various techniques to create more involved, more interesting and more compelling animations for their applications.

video_library.title: Android Design for UI Developers
video_library.desc: Design on Android is no longer a complex mystery of disjointed patterns; the Android design guidelines have paved the way for a design renaissance following the tenets of content forward and responsive mobile design. In this talk we'll explore the arsenal of tools available to Android UI engineers that let you implement some of these important guidelines, including responsive design with multi-pane layouts, metrics and layout grids, and core navigation components.

video_library.title: Stunning Mobile Visualization with CSS Filters
video_library.desc: The future platform for reading is mobile. Creating a compelling digital magazine experience requires taking advantage of leading web platform features. CSS filters bring powerful creative control for content and now take advantage of GPUs on mobile devices. This session will cover content creation for state of the art digital documents explaining how these features work, best practices for performance, packaging for deployment and integration with other cutting edge CSS features.

video_library.title: Web Page Design with the GPU in Mind
Web Components in Action
video_library.desc: This session builds on technologies and concepts discussed in a previous session, "Web Components: a tectonic shift for web development". This year web development gets a whole lot better thanks to the incredible power of Web Components. Our goal in this session is to show you how to use polyfills to help you realize tomorrow's web platform today. As browsers implement these new specifications, that shim layer gets smaller, better, and faster over time. We'll talk about shadow DOM, custom elements, declarative data/event binding, touch input, smooth animations, and how you can combine them to create awesome apps. Write less boilerplate, target every platform, and be more productive by using the next generation of the web platform.

video_library.title: Integrate Google Drive with Google Apps Script
video_library.desc: With the Google Drive SDK, developers can integrate custom "Create" and "Open With" menus within the Google Drive interface and reach tens of millions of users. Using Apps Script API in conjunction with the Google Drive SDK, developers can take advantage of the unique capabilities of Apps Script while also developing entirely on the Google Cloud! We will also demonstrate how you can get programmatic access to files and folders in Drive via Apps Script.

video_library.title: Seeing the World Through High DPI
video_library.desc: Almost every new mobile device today ships with a high DPI screen. That trend has started branching out to laptops, and it’s only a matter of time until every device we use is high DPI. In this talk we’ll dive into what high DPI means and how you can optimize your sites so they look great in any form factor.  You’ll learn 1) how different “pixels” affect layout and how to achieve the layout you want, 2) how layouts are affected by different display densities, and 3) how different image formats can be used to provide the best experience for users ensuring that your site looks great on any device.
